div.p: Greetings. We have received copies of your most holy work published against the pernicious sect of the Anabaptists, most esteemed lord and compater (godfather), and Musculus and I give you immense thanks. He himself would have written to you as well, but due to his occupations, he cannot do so now; however, he will write soon, as I hope, and in return, he sends you his "Loci" (a theological work). Now he wants me to give you our mutual thanks on both our behalves.
Regarding the disaster or calamity at Abbatiscellensis (Abtwil), I have informed our people, who are very sympathetic and, as I believe, will also send an honorarium to them.

From France and Geneva, meanwhile, since I last wrote (which I hope you have received in the meantime), we have received no certain news. We are very surprised about how that tumult is going and what outcome will ensue.
As soon as I learn anything, I will inform you without delay. I recently wrote about Naogeorgus, and I have nothing to add to that now.
I deeply sympathize with the church of Richenwil (Richterswil).
May the Lord preserve it in true purity.

In Augsburg, the Ubiquitarians are causing a great tumult. Those who were previously united with us in the ministry of that church are gluttons and rascals; they remain silent against the testimony of their conscience, they dissimulate, indeed they even join with the adversaries and attack the truth. One person opposes them, a certain schoolmaster Matthias Schenckius from Constance, whose learned writing against ubiquity was recently sent to us. I frequently urge our Musculus to assist the struggling church and truth there with some private and small German writing; for it seems to me that he owes this to God, the truth, and that church which has deserved so well of him. But I cannot push him into this arena.

I would therefore wish that you also give him a nudge, if such a thing seems advisable to you. If you have any certain information about the new council convened in Milan, please let us know; for there is much talk about it among our people. All of ours greet you, especially Musculus, Haller the treasurer, Hagius, my father-in-law, and my mother. Give greetings to all of yours in our name.
To the most distinguished man, Heinrich Bullinger, the most faithful pastor of the church of ZÃ¼rich, his lord and most esteemed compater.
